intro: Dorstenia longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf dorstenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, ovate leaves with a waxy surface. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent stamen. Dorstenia longifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
